'''Itai Benjamini''' is an Israeli mathematician who holds the Renee and Jay Weiss Chair in the Department of Mathematics at the [[Weizmann Institute of Science]].<ref>{{citation|url=http://wis-wander.weizmann.ac.il/prof-itai-benjamini|title=Prof. Itai Benjamini|department=Honors and Awards|journal=Weizmann Wonder Wander: News, Features and Discoveries from the Weizmann Institute|publisher=Weizmann Institute|accessdate=2015-11-01}}; {{citation|url=http://www.weizmann.ac.il/math/faculty|title=The Faculty of Mathematics|publisher=Weizmann Institute|accessdate=2015-11-01}}.</ref>

Benjamini completed his Ph.D. in 1992 at the [[Hebrew University of Jerusalem]], under the supervision of [[Benjamin Weiss]], with a dissertation concerning [[random walk]]s.<ref>{{mathgenealogy|id=58615}}</ref>

With Olle Häggström, Benjamini edited the selected works of [[Oded Schramm]].<ref group="pub">{{citation|mr=2885266 |last=Schramm|first= Oded
|title=Selected works of Oded Schramm|editor1-first= Itai |editor1-last=Benjamini|editor2-first= Olle|editor2-last= Häggström|series=Selected Works in Probability and Statistics|publisher= Springer|place= New York|year= 2011|isbn= 978-1-4419-9674-9 |doi=10.1007/978-1-4419-9675-6}}.</ref> He has also made contributions to topics including the [[Biham–Middleton–Levine traffic model]] for simulating [[traffic flow]] by [[cellular automaton|cellular automata]],<ref group="pub">{{citation |last1=Austin |first1=Tim |last2=Benjamini |first2=Itai|author2-link= Itai Benjamini |arxiv=math/0607759 |title=For what number of cars must self organization occur in the Biham–Middleton–Levine traffic model from any possible starting configuration? |year=2006}}</ref> [[isoperimetric inequality|isoperimetric inequalities]] and [[curve-shortening flow]] on [[Riemannian manifold]]s,<ref group="pub">{{citation
 | last1 = Benjamini | first1 = Itai
 | last2 = Cao | first2 = Jianguo
 | doi = 10.1215/S0012-7094-96-08515-4
 | issue = 2
 | journal = [[Duke Mathematical Journal]]
 | mr = 1417620
 | pages = 359–396
 | title = A new isoperimetric comparison theorem for surfaces of variable curvature
 | volume = 85
 | year = 1996}}.</ref> and the use of the [[circle packing theorem]] to analyze [[random walk]]s on infinite limits of bounded-degree finite [[planar graph]]s.<ref group="pub">{{citation
 | last1 = Benjamini | first1 = Itai
 | last2 = Schramm | first2 = Oded | author2-link = Oded Schramm
 | journal = Electronic Journal of Probability
 | mr = 1873300
 | title = Recurrence of distributional limits of finite planar graphs
 | url = http://www.math.washington.edu/~ejpecp/viewarticle.php?id=1298&layout=abstract
 | volume = 6
 | year = 2001}}.</ref>

In 2004 he won the [[Rollo Davidson Prize]] for young [[probability theory|probability theorists]] "for his work across probability, including the analytic and geometric, particularly in the study of random processes associated with graphs".<ref>{{citation|url=http://www.ams.org/notices/200406/people.pdf|department=Mathematics People|journal=[[Notices of the AMS]]|volume=51|issue=6|page=661|title=Holroyd and Benjamini Awarded Rollo Davidson Prizes|date=June–July 2004}}.</ref> In the same year he also won the Morris L. Levinson Prize of the Weizmann Institute.<ref>{{citation|url=http://www.wisdom.weizmann.ac.il/prizes.html|title=Honors and Prizes to Faculty Members|publisher=Department of Mathematics, Weizmann Institute of Science|accessdate=2015-11-01}}.</ref> He was an [[list of International Congresses of Mathematicians Plenary and Invited Speakers|invited speaker at the International Congress of Mathematicians]] in 2010,<ref>{{citation|url=http://www.mathunion.org/db/ICM/Speakers/SortedByLastname.php|title=ICM Plenary and Invited Speakers since 1897|publisher=[[International Mathematical Union]]|accessdate=2015-11-01}}.</ref> speaking about "random planar metrics".<ref group="pub">{{citation
 | last = Benjamini | first = Itai
 | contribution = Random planar metrics
 | mr = 2827966
 | pages = 2177–2187
 | publisher = Hindustan Book Agency, New Delhi
 | title = Proceedings of the International Congress of Mathematicians
 | volume = IV
 | year = 2010}}.</ref>
